parameters: "Lady Marchworth joined her forces with the Sovereign. There was never a chance here. Even Sir Gaelfry joined them."
"Aye, I noticed that. It would see Lord Caember is the last to hold out against the King.
"At least the piss-yellow bastard Lord Northelm got a face full of my steel."
"'Tis a damned shame. He was the one who appointed my Knighthood..."
"He may have anointed you but he foresake his duty as a Lord to protect his people from a tyrant."
"It matters not now for he has  become one with the Great Storm."
"Don't go preaching that storm crap to me. When you die, you're dead and the worms and crows eat you. That's it."
"I forgot, Sir, you are from the Stormlands. It was an honor to fight by the side of a Stormlander."
"The pleasure t'was all mine, Dame Clairmont. And the honor is mine to die in such fine company."
"The only dying that's gonna happen are the Sovereign. Lord Kole's face is mine to mount to my wall."
"It would appear that they are upon us now..."
"Fight well, and die well if it comes to that."
Let them come, none will pass this bridge as long as I draw breath!"
*Sir Roelf leans heavily on his spear.*
"I'm not sure how much more I got in me."
"My ability to carry on are also waning..."
"Then kindly quit the battle, Arch-Master. The same offers extends to all of you."
"There is no reason why any more need to die today. It's your Lord Caember that must meet the King's justice."
"We took our oaths to serve our Lords faithfully. That means we shall die in service if that's what is required."
"I truly wish our meeting was under better circumstances."
"Sir Roelf, Dame Clairmont... it saddens me also, as was it not just a mere month past that we broke bread togther?"
"My Lady, you honored me with your hospitality. But, I must stay true to my Lord."
"As must I... I do hope you will forgive me. Your friendship meant a great deal to me."
"I ask you, as a friend, Sir Eiryk... Please step aside."
"Then by order of King Godwane the Unifier, I command you to step aside."
"None of us can obey that order."
"In that case, it is our duty to carry out the King's command. I am sorry, my friend."
